Congressman A votes for Congressman B's legislation on the agreement that Congressman B will vote for Congressman A's pork when it comes around.  We have little control over who's elected other than choosing one of the pre-determined candidates who will benefit the party to the greatest extent. An early post described our Democratic Republic as out-dated. Not true! The US is technically a Republic for only one reason: The Electoral College. Since the president is elected INDIRECTLY (we vote for electors who promise to vote for a specific candidate in the electoral college) we are a Republic. In fact, the Senate used to work this way, too. The members of the House of Representatives used to decide (vote) who was in the Senate...
 
 Anyway, the reason why our system is not out of date is that it still serves its purpose. The purpose of the electoral college is to make sure that urban voters don't control who is in government. The rural communities have very different needs and wishes that would go un-noticed in a strict Democracy. Populated centers still have a huge impact on national issues and elections. For example, Florida gets 25 electoral votes while Wyoming gets only 3. The number of electors for each state is equal to the number of House of Rep. members that state has in Congress plus two more for the Senators.
